sen.j: 菟道稚郎子（うじのわきいらつこ、生年不詳 - 壬申年（312年））は、記紀に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(菟道稚郎子) Uji no Wakiiratsuko; his date birth is unknown and his date of death was in '312.'] appeared in the Kiki ["Kojiki" (A Record of Ancient Matter) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)] as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.

Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(菟道稚郎子) Uji no Wakiiratsuko; his date birth is unknown and his date of death was in '312.'] appeared in the Kiki ["Kojiki" (A Record of Ancient Matter) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)] as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(菟道稚郎子) Uji no Wakiiratsuko; his date birth is unknown and his date of death was in '312.'] appeared in the Kiki ["Kojiki" (A Record of Ancient Matter) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)] as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 菟道稚郎子皇子（『日本書紀』）・宇遅能和紀郎子（『古事記』）・宇治若郎子（『山城国風土記』逸文）・宇治天皇（『播磨国風土記』）とも。
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko (菟道稚郎子) also known as; Imperial Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(菟道稚郎子皇子), in the "Nihonshoki"]; Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(宇遅能和紀郎子), in the "Kojiki"]; Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(宇治若郎子), in the "Yamashiro no Kuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Yamashiro Province)]; and the Emperor Uji [(宇治天皇), in the "Harimanokuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Harima Province)].

Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko (菟道稚郎子) also known as; Imperial Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(菟道稚郎子皇子), in the "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]]; Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(宇遅能和紀郎子), in the "Kojiki" [The Records of Ancient Matters]]; Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(宇治若郎子), in the "Yamashiro no Kuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Yamashiro Province)]; and the Emperor Uji [(宇治天皇), in the "Harimanokuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Harima Province)].
sen.cmt: 日本書紀と古事記は初出なので、定訳を加えました。
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko (菟道稚郎子) also known as; Imperial Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(菟道稚郎子皇子), in the "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]]; Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(宇遅能和紀郎子), in the "Kojiki" [The Records of Ancient Matters]]; Uji no Wakiiratsuko [(宇治若郎子), in the "Yamashiro no Kuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Yamashiro Province)]; and the Emperor Uji [(宇治天皇), in the "Harimanokuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Harima Province)].
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 応神天皇の皇子で、母は和珥氏祖の日触使主（ひふれのおみ、比布礼能意富美）の女 ・宮主宅媛（みやぬしやかひめ、宮主矢河枝比売）である（ただし『先代旧事本紀』には、物部多遅麻連の女・山無媛とする）。
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko was Imperial prince of the Emperor Ojin, and the mother of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko was Miyanushi Yakahimi [(宮主宅媛), also known as Miyanushi Yagahaehime (宮主矢河枝比売)], a daughter of Hifure no Ohomi [(日触使主); his name was also written in this way "比布礼能意富美") in being an ancestor of the Wani Uji Clan.] [However, according to the "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), the mother of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko appeared as Yamanashi Hime (山無媛), a daughter of 'Mononobe no Tajima no Muraji' (物部多遅麻連).].

Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko was Imperial prince of the Emperor Ojin, and his mother was Miyanushi Yakahimi [(宮主宅媛), also known as Miyanushi Yagahaehime (宮主矢河枝比売)], a daughter of Hifure no Ohomi [(日触使主); his name was also written in this way "比布礼能意富美") in being an ancestor of the Wani Uji Clan.] [However, according to the "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), the mother of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko appeared as Yamanashi Hime (山無媛), a daughter of 'Mononobe no Tajima no Muraji' (物部多遅麻連).].
sen.cmt: the mother of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko→his motherに変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko was Imperial prince of the Emperor Ojin, and his mother was Miyanushi Yakahimi [(宮主宅媛), also known as Miyanushi Yagahaehime (宮主矢河枝比売)], a daughter of Hifure no Ohomi [(日触使主); his name was also written in this way "比布礼能意富美") in being an ancestor of the Wani Uji Clan.] [However, according to the "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), the mother of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko appeared as Yamanashi Hime (山無媛), a daughter of 'Mononobe no Tajima no Muraji' (物部多遅麻連).].
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 同母妹に八田皇女・雌鳥皇女。
sen.e: Younger sisters of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko, who had the same mother and the same father, were the Imperial Princess Yata no Hime [(八田皇女) Yata no Hime Miko] and Imperial Princess Metori no Hime [(雌鳥皇女) Metori no Hime Miko].
Younger maternal half-sisters of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko were Imperial Princess Yata no Hime [(八田皇女) Yata no Hime Miko] and Imperial Princess Metori no Hime [(雌鳥皇女) Metori no Hime Miko].
sen.cmt: 同母妹の訳の所を変更しました。
sen.e: Younger maternal half-sisters of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko were Imperial Princess Yata no Hime [(八田皇女) Yata no Hime Miko] and Imperial Princess Metori no Hime [(雌鳥皇女) Metori no Hime Miko].
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 父天皇の寵愛を受けて皇太子に立てられた。
sen.e: Although the Emperor Ojin, the prince's father, favored Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko and chose him as the Crown Prince; Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko tried to hand over the Imperial Throne to Prince Osazaki [(大鷦鷯尊) Osazaki no Mikoto], his paternal elder half brother.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although the Emperor Ojin, the prince's father, favored Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko and chose him as the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: ; Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko tried to hand over the Imperial Throne to Prince Osazaki [(大鷦鷯尊) Osazaki no Mikoto], his paternal elder half brother.の部分が無いので、割愛いたしました。
sen.e: Although the Emperor Ojin, the prince's father, favored Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko and chose him as the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィ ’→ '

sen.j: ものの、異母兄の大鷦鷯尊（おおさざきのみこと、後の仁徳天皇）に皇位を譲るべく自殺したという美談で知られる。
sen.e: Then Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko would commit suicide in order to pass the Imperial Throne to Prince Osazaki; this episode became a well known and beautiful story in Japan..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko would commit suicide in order to pass the Imperial Throne to Prince Osazaki (Osazaki no Mikoto, later Emperor Nintoku); this episode became a well known and beautiful story in Japan.
sen.cmt: (Osazaki no Mikoto, later Emperor Nintoku) の補足、およびピリオド処理。
sen.e: Then Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko would commit suicide in order to pass the Imperial Throne to Prince Osazaki (Osazaki no Mikoto, later Emperor Nintoku); this episode became a well known and beautiful story in Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 百済から来朝した阿直岐・王仁を師に典籍を学んだ。
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko learned the books with instructors who visited Japan from Paekche ("Kudara" in Japanese; an ancient Korean kingdom) such as, Achiki (an emissary sent from Paekche) and Wani (Wang In).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko learned from the books with instructors, Achiki (an emissary sent from Paekche) and Wani (Wang In), who visited Japan from Paekche ("Kudara" in Japanese; an ancient Korean kingdom).
sen.cmt: fromの挿入、一部変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko learned from the books with instructors, Achiki (an emissary sent from Paekche) and Wani (Wang In), who visited Japan from Paekche ("Kudara" in Japanese; an ancient Korean kingdom).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 通達し、父の天皇から寵愛された。
sen.e: He then recited the contents, and thus became favored by his father, the Emperor Ojin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He attained proficient knowledge, and hus became favored by his father, the Emperor Ojin.
sen.cmt: 通達’の英訳を変更しました。
sen.e: He attained proficient knowledge, and hus became favored by his father, the Emperor Ojin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応神天皇40年（309年）1月 (旧暦)に皇太子となる。
sen.e: In January of '309,' Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko became the Crown Prince.
In 309, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko became the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 旧暦の月を削除しました。
sen.e: In 309, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko became the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌年に天皇が崩じたが、太子は即位せず。
sen.e: The next year, the Emperor Ojin died, but the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) did not ascend to the throne.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The next year, the Emperor Ojin passed away, but the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) did not ascend to the throne.
sen.cmt: died→passed awayに変更しました。
sen.e: The next year, the Emperor Ojin passed away, but the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) did not ascend to the throne.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大鷦鷯尊と互いに皇位を譲り合った。
sen.e: Then, the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) and Prince Osazaki formed a compromise, handing over the Imperial Throne to each other, shared between two of them, back and forth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, Prince Uji and Prince Osazaki insisted on devolving the Imperial throne on each other.
sen.cmt: 譲り合った’の部分を変更しました。
sen.e: Then, Prince Uji and Prince Osazaki insisted on devolving the Imperial throne on each other.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのような中、異母兄の大山守皇子は自らが太子に立てなかったことを恨み、太子を殺そうと挙兵する。
sen.e: On the other hand, Prince Oyamamori (大山守皇子), a paternal elder half brother, bore malice toward the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) since he was not chosen to be the Crown Prince himself; he raised his army against the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) to kill the Crown Prince.

On the other hand, Prince Oyamamori (大山守皇子), an older paternal half-brother, bore malice toward Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko since he was not chosen to be the Crown Prince himself; he raised his army against Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko to kill him.
sen.cmt: the Crown Princeを３か所削除し、異母兄を定訳に沿って一部変更しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Prince Oyamamori (大山守皇子), an older paternal half-brother, bore malice toward Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko since he was not chosen to be the Crown Prince himself; he raised his army against Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko to kill him.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大鷦鷯尊はこれをいち早く察知し、大山守皇子はかえって太子の謀略に遭って殺された。
sen.e: Prince Osazaki immediately realized there was an assassination conspiracy, then the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) killed Prince Oyamamori for his plotting.
Prince Osazaki immediately realized his assassination conspiracy, and Prince Oyamamori was killed by the plot of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko conversely.
sen.cmt: the Crown Princeを削除および一部変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Osazaki immediately realized his assassination conspiracy, and Prince Oyamamori was killed by the plot of Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko conversely.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この後、太子は菟道宮（京都府宇治市の宇治上神社が伝承地。
sen.e: After this incident, the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) moved into
After this incident, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko moved into Uji no miya Palace [(菟道宮); Uji Gami Shirine is its legendary place, located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture
sen.cmt: the Crown Princeを削除および場所の英訳を入れました。
sen.e: After this incident, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko moved into Uji no miya Palace [(菟道宮); Uji Gami Shirine is its legendary place, located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『山城国風土記』逸文に桐原日桁宮）に住まう。
sen.e: Uji no miya Palace [(菟道宮); 'Uji Gami Shirine' was a legendary place, this shrine was located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture; the location was written of in an itsubun (unknown or lost writing) article inside the "Yamashiro no Kuni Fudoki" as "Kiriharahigeta no miya (桐原日桁宮)"].
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Itsubun (unknown or lost writing) article inside the "Yamashiro no Kuni Fudoki" describes that he lived in Kiriharahigeta no miya (桐原日桁宮).
sen.cmt: 場所の部分を除きました。
sen.e: Itsubun (unknown or lost writing) article inside the "Yamashiro no Kuni Fudoki" describes that he lived in Kiriharahigeta no miya (桐原日桁宮).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、大鷦鷯尊と皇位を譲り合うこと3年。
sen.e: Then, the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) and Prince Osazaki continued the compromised; they were handing over the Imperial Throne to each other and could not decide who was going to take in the charge, for over the next three years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko and Prince Osazaki had been talking about the Imperial Throne for over the next three years.
sen.cmt: the Crown Princeを削除して書きました。
sen.e: Then, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko and Prince Osazaki had been talking about the Imperial Throne for over the next three years.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 永らくの空位が天下の煩いになると思い悩んだ太子は互譲に決着を期すべく、自ら果てた。
sen.e: Afterward, the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) was worried the prolonged vacancy on the Imperial Throne could lead to the disaster of the nation; then he finally decided to that the taking of his own life would end this compromise for the Imperial Throne.

Afterward, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko was worried the prolonged vacancy on the Imperial Throne could lead to the disaster of the nation; then he finally decided taking his own life to settle the issue on the Imperial Throne.
sen.cmt: the Crown Princeを1か所削除し一部変更しました。
sen.e: Afterward, Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko was worried the prolonged vacancy on the Imperial Throne could lead to the disaster of the nation; then he finally decided taking his own life to settle the issue on the Imperial Throne.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 尊は驚き悲しんで、難波から菟道宮に至り。
sen.e: Prince Osazaki was saddened and then approached the Uji no miya Palace via Naniwa (Osaka prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処.。 "原文の「大阪歴史と地名の変遷から菟道宮に至り」と言う文が意味が不明で、ウエブの方では、「難波から菟道宮に至り」とありますので、其方へ修正致しました。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8F%9F%E9%81%93%E7%A8%9A%E9%83%8E%E5%AD%90 "
sen.e: Prince Osazaki was saddened and then approached the Uji no miya Palace via Naniwa (Osaka prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Prince Osazaki was saddened and then approached the Uji no miya Palace via Naniwa (Osaka prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 遺体に招魂の術を施したところ、太子は蘇生し、妹の八田皇女を献ずる旨の遺言をし。
sen.e: When Prince Osazaki performed Shokon (invocation of the dead) ceremony for the Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko), the Crown Prince suddenly resuscitated, long enough to declare his will, that he would present Princess Yata no Hime (八田皇女) as his (Prince Osazaki) princess.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処.。
sen.e: When Prince Osazaki performed Shokon (invocation of the dead) ceremony for the Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko, he suddenly resuscitated, long enough to declare his will, that he would present Princess Yata no Hime (八田皇女) as princess of Prince Osazaki.
sen.cmt: the Crown Princeを削除および一部変更しました。
sen.e: When Prince Osazaki performed Shokon (invocation of the dead) ceremony for the Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko, he suddenly resuscitated, long enough to declare his will, that he would present Princess Yata no Hime (八田皇女) as princess of Prince Osazaki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 再び薨じたという。
sen.e: Then, the Crown Prince met his demise once more.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処.。
sen.e: Then, the Crown Prince met his demise once more.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Then, the Crown Prince met his demise once more.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 菟道山上（『延喜式』諸陵寮に宇治墓）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) was buried in the Todo-san mountain [In "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), this place was entered in the text as the "Uji burial mound" under the section of Shoryouryou (an administrative organization established by the Ritsuryo laws)].

The Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) was buried in the Todo-san mountain (In "the Engishiki" [an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers], this place was entered in the text as the "Uji burial mound" under the section of Shoryouryou [an administrative organization established by the Ritsuryo laws]).
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更をしました。
sen.e: The Crown Prince (Prince Uji no Wakiiratsuko) was buried in the Todo-san mountain (In "the Engishiki" [an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers], this place was entered in the text as the "Uji burial mound" under the section of Shoryouryou [an administrative organization established by the Ritsuryo laws]).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 同墓は現在、宇治市莵道丸山の丸山古墳（前方後円墳・全長約80m）に比定される。
sen.e: This burial mound is currently identified as Maruyama Kofun (It is a keyhole-shaped mound, with a total length is eighty meters.) in Todo Maruyama, Uji City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処.。
sen.e: This burial mound is currently identified as Maruyama Kofun (It is a keyhole-shaped mound, with a total length is about eighty meters.) in Todo Maruyama, Uji City.
sen.cmt: about を補足しました。
sen.e: This burial mound is currently identified as Maruyama Kofun (It is a keyhole-shaped mound, with a total length is about eighty meters.) in Todo Maruyama, Uji City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ここは、宮内庁の管理下にある。
sen.e: Now, the Ministry of the Imperial Household manages this place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処.。
sen.e: Now, the Ministry of the Imperial Household manages this place.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Now, the Ministry of the Imperial Household manages this place.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
